title: Technical Recruiter
description:
Why do we need you?

Appsilon is growing, and we are expanding our team of developers worldwide, especially in LATAM! With more clients and exciting new projects, we need talented developers to help us deliver top-quality solutions. That’s where you come in—finding the right people to join our team and helping us continue to meet our clients' expectations while driving our company’s growth.

We’re also building and strengthening our People Team, and your expertise will play a key role in shaping it.

If you have experience in a similar role, are eager to grow in a technology company, and are an energetic, detail-oriented, and fast-paced professional who communicates fluently in English, this is the perfect opportunity for you!

Role Objectives:

  • We have a high-quality team and we provide high-quality services for our clients.
  • Recruitment processes are well thought-out, optimized, and effective.
  • Hiring managers understand the recruitment process and know their responsibilities.
  • Our recruitment is the best experience for candidates.
  • The company executes its strategy thanks to a well-chosen team.
  • Appsilon is the first choice for candidates.
  • Other teams (Sales, Tech) know the hiring situation and can plan their work.

What we expect from you:

  • Minimum 1-2 years of IT recruitment experience, with a focus on high-quality candidate selection.
  • Proven track record of independently leading end-to-end recruitment processes.
  • Strong English language skills (B2 level minimum).
  • Proficient in using ATS and LinkedIn Recruiter for candidate sourcing.
  • Successful experience in engaging and attracting passive candidates.
  • In-depth knowledge of LATAM job boards and their functionality.
  • Good understanding of the Tech (R/Shiny) job market in LATAM, including hiring trends and best practices.
  • Ambitious, with a passion for further development in recruitment and a desire to become a specialist in the field.
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with a clear and compelling approach.
  • Creative, fearless problem-solver who thrives in challenging situations.
  • High-energy, likeable, and adaptable personality, even in remote setups.
  • Demonstrating impeccable manners and professionalism.
  • Fast learner who takes accountability for their actions and seeks improvement.
  • Honest and trustworthy, fostering a culture of openness and reliability.
  • Based in the LATAM timezone but also open to working in the EU timezone.
  • Have a valid passport or ID card.
  • Alignment with Appsilon’s company values, core purpose, and Code of Conduct.

Why Appsilon is a good place for you:

  • Specialization in Core Technology: Appsilon excels in our core technology, and our expertise is acknowledged by R/Shiny developers, making us a preferred destination for tech enthusiasts.
  • Strong Support and Growth: You will receive dedicated support from our Head of People, who will introduce you to the company and assist in your professional growth.
  • Diverse Recruitment Opportunities: Explore the chance to recruit for various roles in areas like Frontend, Backend, DevOps, Sales, Finance, Growth, and more, broadening your expertise.
  • Collaboration with Different Managers: Work closely with Hiring Managers from diverse technical and business backgrounds, fostering a rich and rewarding work experience.
  • Quality Over Quantity: At Appsilon, we prioritize the quality of candidates over quantity, emphasizing a focused and thoughtful recruitment approach.
  • Empowerment for Impact: Your contributions will significantly impact the recruitment team as we actively encourage and value your ideas and insights.
  • Impactful Work: Your efforts will have a real impact on the overall success of the company, driving us towards excellence.
  • Supportive Team: Join an incredible team that stands by one another, offering unwavering support throughout your journey at Appsilon.
  • Accelerated Specialist Development: We prioritize your growth, enabling you to become a recruitment specialist swiftly.
  • Diverse Engagement: Apart from recruitment, you can engage in a wide range of activities, including onboarding, offboarding, Employer Branding, Team Building, culture development, diversity initiatives, and more, adding diversity to your role.
  • Appsilon is remote-only.

What’s in it for you:

  • 1600 USD + VAT on B2B/monthly / full time.
  • 26 days of paid holidays + an equivalent of public holidays in Poland, est. 11 days in 2025.
  • 33 paid sick leave days/year (paid 80%).
  • +5% of salary in Professional Development Budget to spend on activities that help you grow.
  • Remote work with flexible working hours adjusted to your time zone and family life.
  • 4 paid days per year to be used for training/conferences, events, or workshops.
  • Private health care insurance (in Poland) or cash equivalent if you’re not in Poland.
  • FitProfit or FitSport membership card (in Poland) or cash equivalent if you’re not in Poland.
  • Life insurance for you and your family.
  • AskHenry - a personal assistant.

Within 3 Months, You’ll…

  • You will be responsible for 2 end-to-end recruitment projects.
  • You will successfully close your first recruitment at Appsilon.

Within 6 Months, You’ll…

  • You will be responsible for 3 end-to-end recruitment projects.
  • You will be the backup for the person responsible for onboarding.
  • You will be familiar with internal processes and be able to improve and optimize them.

What can you expect during the recruitment process?

  • Interview with the Recruiter.
  • Recruitment task.
  • Interview with the Hiring Manager.

title: Not open Refrigeration Mechanic
description:
As a Refrigeration Mechanic you will be part of the team which maintains and develops the Australian stations on the Antarctic continent and at Macquarie Island. You will install and maintain station domestic and commercial refrigeration plant as well as assisting with general maintenance and construction as required.

Refrigeration Mechanics generally work in summer jobs only, with the station location dependent on requirements. Winter jobs are occasionally available when required for a specific project.

The Australian Antarctic Program’s (AAP) vision is to ensure Antarctica is valued, protected and understood. Working with the AAP provides a unique opportunity to experience Antarctica and the Southern Ocean, while supporting world-leading science.

The AAP aims to support expeditioner growth, professionally and personally, with a focus on wellbeing. We strive to employ versatile, proactive and community minded people. Expeditioners will need to contribute to a small team and be resilient as they face the challenges of living in an isolated environment.

Employment conditions
  • The annual base salary when in Australia starts from $82,993 per annum .
  • Base salary + additional allowances when in Antarctica starts from $150,947 per annum .
  • A generous employer superannuation contribution of up to 15.4% will be paid in addition to salary and allowances.
  • You will accrue recreation leave at the equivalent of 20 days per annum pro rata. Please note that recreation leave is not available in Antarctica but will be paid out on return to Australia.
What we are looking for

To apply for this role you must have the skills and licences listed below:

Qualifications/licences
  • Trade or Technical Certificate/Apprenticeship – or recognised equivalent as a Refrigeration Mechanic
  • Australian Refrigeration Council – Current, full registration and air-conditioning licence
  • Citizenship – In accordance with the PS Act 1999, Australian Public Service employees are required to be Australian citizens. Persons who are not Australian citizens will generally only be considered where there are no suitable Australian applicants, with next considerations being Australian residents with work rights and New Zealand citizens.
Obtain prior to commencement
  • White Card (issued after May 2009), or the ability to attain prior to commencement
  • Valid Passport – The expiry date of the passport (and any relevant visa) must be at least 6 months beyond the planned end date of your intended stay in the Antarctic or sub-Antarctic
  • Provide First Aid (HLTAID0011) must be valid for at least 18 months beyond the date of AAD commencement
  • Provide CPR (HLTAID009) must be valid for at least 6 months beyond the date of AAD commencement.
Knowledge and experience
  • A minimum of 3 years’ post trade experience
  • Broad general experience within the refrigeration mechanic trade.
Recent hands-on experience (within the last 5 years)
  • A current, unrestricted electrical worker’s licence which qualifies you to undertake electrical work in Australia
  • The installation and maintenance of packaged refrigeration units for −18 degrees Celsius and +4 degrees Celsius cool rooms up 20 kW
  • Maintenance of refrigeration systems for temperature-controlled shipping containers
  • Maintenance of glycol chillers which employ shell and tube heat exchange and ice ball systems
  • Construction and maintenance of cool rooms using insulated panel systems and associated cool room hardware
  • Configuration and fault finding of electronic refrigeration controllers and sensors
  • Managing cylinder stocks of refrigerant gases including conducting leak testing and reclaiming refrigerants
  • Experience with R404A, R134A and R409 refrigerants and experience with upgrading from legacy refrigerants such as R12 and R22
  • Maintenance of laboratory refrigeration systems including controlled temperature cabinets.
  • Maintenance of domestic heat pumps and refrigerators
  • Experience in the installation or maintenance of building heating and ventilation systems (air handling and heating/cooling water) is desirable.
Additional

Although not critical for your application to be successful, it is useful to have some understanding of any additional licenses you may have.

  • Restricted Electrical Licence
  • Working Safely at Heights
  • Confined space
  • Scaffolding
  • Elevated work platform
  • Operation of a crane
  • Telescopic materials handler
  • Loader
  • Excavator
Other requirements

As a proactive and positive member of the community you will:

  • Maintain a personal and practical commitment to AAD policies and standard operating procedures (including work, health and safety and environmental policies). Training and guidance in regard to all responsibilities relevant to your position will be provided.
  • Be rostered to perform duties to support the community life of the expedition, such as general kitchen duties, garbage clearance, general cleaning duties, and assisting other expedition members with official programs, to ensure an equitable contribution.
  • Work in areas outside of your primary role, for example, aiding other areas or science projects, or participating in general labouring tasks such as clearing snow or handling cargo.
Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At the AAD, we value diversity in all its forms – background, experience, and perspective. We recognise the challenges that come with our work and are committed to fostering an inclusive culture for all. We encourage applications from everyone, especially people from under-represented groups like Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, women, gender-diverse people, LGBTQIA+ communities, and those of different cultural and linguistic backgrounds.

During the recruitment selection process the AAD assesses individual personal qualities expeditioners need to successfully live and work in an isolated Antarctic/sub-Antarctic community.

Covid-19

Expeditioners must comply with the AAD’s Infectious Respiratory Disease Management Plan, including the requirement to have had a COVID-19 vaccination or a medically documented COVID-19 infection, within 12 months of deployment.

For job specific (technical or trade related) enquiries, or to discuss the role in more detail, please contact

If you would like to be notified about future Antarctic job opportunities, sign up to our mailing list.

title: Analista Financeiro Sênior
description:
Está em busca de um futuro emocionante? Então, nós temos uma excelente oportunidade.

Na Anglo American, acreditamos em resultados extraordinários. Isso significa que estamos sempre procurando novas e melhores maneiras de fazer as coisas.

Guiados por nosso objetivo e valores, promovemos alto desempenho e ação com foco no propósito de "Reimaginar a mineração para melhorar a vida das pessoas". Somos incondicionais diante a segurança, saúde e bem-estar de nossos empregados, seja no trabalho, em casa, e nas comunidades onde trabalhamos.

Nosso objetivo é liderar o setor investindo em inovação para proteger as pessoas, que são o coração de nossos negócios. Nossas equipes assumem a responsabilidade por suas próprias ações e dos demais, trabalham de forma colaborativa e sempre demonstram cuidado e respeito.

Com sede em Londres, Reino Unido, e operações localizadas em todo o mundo, a Anglo American é realmente uma empresa global. Empregamos mais de 60.000 colegas em todo o mundo e gerenciamos operações de mineração na África do Sul, América do Norte e do Sul e Austrália.

No Brasil, atuamos com dois negócios: Minério de ferro, com Minas-Rio, localizado nos estados de Minas Gerais e Rio de Janeiro; e Níquel, com operações nos municípios de Barro Alto e Niquelândia, em Goiás. Além disso, temos estrutura corporativa localizada em Belo Horizonte.

Estamos buscando talentos que compartilhem nossos valores e nossa crença em um futuro melhor, mais seguro, diverso e respeitoso para a mineração. Você pode ser um deles!

Você como Analista Financeiro Sênior, será responsável pelo atendimento das áreas nas atividades relacionadas a investimentos (SIB/Capex), incluindo o budget, forecast, gestão da rotina, análises de riscos e oportunidades, melhorias de processos e reportes que atendam as necessidades de gestão.

Veja abaixo as principais atividades:

  • Elaborar e revisar o orçamento junto às áreas, garantindo o cumprimento das normas contábeis e diretrizes internas, e validar o budget para os próximos 5 anos.
  • Revisar o forecast mensalmente, identificar e discutir riscos e oportunidades e analisar a performance (real vs orçado), identificando desvios e suas causas raízes.
  • Conciliar as informações com os reportes necessários e preparar apresentações em PowerPoint para divulgação de dados de fechamento, budget e forecast.

O perfil que estamos buscando para essa posição:

  • Graduação completa em Contabilidade ou Administração
  • Vivência nos Softwares: Pacote Office (Excel, Power Point, Word) e SAP - nível intermediário
  • Conhecimento nas ferramentas Think Cell, Hyperion e Power BI - nível básico
  • Inglês em nível intermediário será um diferencial

Por que fazer parte do nosso time?

Somos uma empresa empenhada em fazer nossas crenças e valores acontecerem de verdade. O objetivo é proporcionar a você um ambiente de qualidade, diverso e seguro para que você desenvolva o seu melhor. Para isso, oferecemos os melhores benefícios:

Para cuidar da sua saúde física e mental:

Gympass, Plano de Saúde e Odontológico (extensivo a você e seus dependentes), além de Assistência Psicológica e Aplicativo Saúde Emocional.

Especial para você e sua família:

Auxílio Creche, Programa Família, Brinquedo de Natal e Vale Alimentação!

Espaço para ser você mesmo:

Fique à vontade para participar de nossos Grupos de Afinidades e dos eventos incríveis da Semana da Diversidade!

Plano de Previdência Privada diferenciado.

Transporte fretado, refeições no local de trabalho, remuneração variável, Seguro de Vida, Apoio e orientação: Jurídico, financeiro, social e psicológico.

Como estamos comprometidos com a sua segurança?

Nada é mais importante para nós do que garantir que você volte para casa com segurança após um dia de trabalho. Para que isso aconteça, temos os padrões de segurança mais rigorosos do setor. Além disso, também estamos investindo continuamente em novas tecnologias, de drones a análise de dados, que estão ajudando a tornar a mineração mais segura.

Inclusão e Diversidade

Temos o compromisso de promover um ambiente de trabalho inclusivo e diversificado, no qual valorizamos e respeitamos cada colega por quem ela/ele é. Acolhemos e celebramos todas as identidades de gênero, etnias, idades, espiritualidades, orientações sexuais, deficiências, classes sociais, estilos de vida e habilidades. E foi para escutar todas essas vozes que criamos os Grupos de Afinidades: espaços seguros para discutir, refletir e construir ações de inclusão e diversidade no âmbito da equidade de gênero, LGBTQIAP+, etnia, pessoas com deficiência e geracional.

Nós queremos colegas que se sintam valorizados, respeitados e sintam-se abertos para trazer seu “verdadeiro eu” para o trabalho.

*Reforçamos que todas as vagas estão abertas para pessoas com deficiência (PcD) e reabilitados do INSS.

Para se candidatar a essa vaga, realize seu cadastro on-line, e anexe seu currículo no ato da inscrição.

Nosso processo seletivo, de forma geral, é constituído das seguintes etapas: inscrição, análise dos currículos, dinâmica/entrevista, avaliação comportamental, exame médico e admissão.

Fique atento à página da/do candidata/candidato, assim como aos meios de comunicação (e-mail, telefone, WhatsApp), pois todo o processo será mediado por essas plataformas.

Venha com a gente construir o futuro da mineração!

title: Team Leader Contac Center
description:
Analista de reclutamiento y selección | Recursos humanos (RR. HH.)

¿Queres ser parte de una de las mejores empresas para trabajar de Argentina? En Verisure Argentina contamos con la certificación #GreatPlaceToWork

Te invitamos a formar parte de una compañía multinacional líder en el sector de Sistemas de Seguridad, cuyo posicionamiento se centra en sus soluciones tecnológicas innovadoras, la conectividad de sus sistemas y la experiencia de cliente. Estamos presentes en más de 17 países alrededor del mundo y contamos con una trayectoria de más de 35 años en el mercado.

Actualmente, estamos en la búsqueda de Team Leader de Contact Center para incorporarse al equipo de Marketing , donde sus principales tareas estarán relacionadas a la gestión de una nómina operativa (10 /15 operadores), gestión de leads y llamadas entrantes para la creación de Bookings (Visitas) y seguimiento de métricas de la gestión.

Modalidad de trabajo presencial en nuestras oficinas ubicadas en Palermo, de lunes a domingos de 12 a 21hs o 15 a 00hs (2 francos rotativos semanales).

¿Cuáles serán tus responsabilidades?

  • Gestión y motivación de nómina operativa teniendo en cuenta los KPIs claves para mejorar la eficiencia de la campaña.
  • Motivación y liderazgo con gestión en sala (en línea) de equipos de trabajo.
  • Análisis y reporting de la gestión y campaña asignada para brindar feedback semanal a su nómina y líderes.
  • Monitoreos Online y Offline.
  • Gestión de llamadas entrantes y salientes.
  • Establecer propuestas de mejoras para el sector.
  • Selección de nuevas incorporaciones a los equipos.
  • Comprobable experiencia gestionando equipos de Call Center Comerciales, venta de productos tangibles e intangibles (Mínimo 2 años de experiencia).
  • Contar con conocimientos intermedios del Paquete Office (Excel).
  • Gestión de clientes.
  • Orientación a objetivos.
  • Gestión de procesos.
  • Planificación y organización.
  • Tolerancia a la frustración.

¡Sumate a Verisure y disfrutá de todos estos beneficios increíbles!

  • Variable por consecución de objetivos
  • Beneficio de Almuerzo a través de Mercado Pago
  • Programa de bienestar integral: With You, For You , que abarca asistencia psicológica & emocional
  • Desarrollo y Aprendizaje profesional a través de plataformas de E-Learning y Capacitaciones
  • Plataforma de Beneficios Exclusiva : acceso a precios especiales en primeras marcas.
  • Descuentos en importantes Universidades y Centros de Estudios .
  • Plataforma de Inversiones con asesoramiento personalizado.
  • Descuentos Exclusivos de Grupo Bimbo .
  • Descuento en Alarmas para Empleados Verisure.

Sabemos que la cultura organizacional es clave para elegir tu próximo desafío profesional. Por este motivo, te queremos presentar el ADN de Verisure Argentina para que conozcas nuestra propuesta de valor que nos hace una de las mejores empresas para trabajar en nuestro país:

  • Pasión en todo lo que hacemos.
  • Compromiso para marcar la diferencia.
  • Confianza y responsabilidad.

En Verisure estamos comprometidos con fomentar un entorno de trabajo diverso e inclusivo, reconociendo que la diversidad de pensamiento y antecedentes solo fortalece e impulsa la innovación en nuestros equipos. Rechazamos todas las formas de discriminación y prejuicio y creemos en el acceso equitativo a oportunidades para todas las personas independientemente de su género, edad, discapacidad, raza, orientación sexual u cualquier otro factor.

¡Si consideras que compartís estos valores con nosotros, te invitamos a ser parte de Verisure Argentina para proteger juntos lo que más nos importa!
